environments.name: Void Chamber
environments.description: A playtest environment where reality becomes unstable.
environments.impulses: Test the boundaries of reality, challenge perceptions

features.name: Reality Flux
features.description: The chamber's walls and floor shift unpredictably. PCs must succeed on an Agility Roll to move safely or risk falling into a temporary void pocket.

features.name: Void Echo
features.description: Spend a Fear to create an echo of one of the PCs that acts as an adversary for one turn.

environments.name: Grand Feast
environments.description: A community-wide celebration featuring way too much drink, food, and fun.
environments.impulses: Bring everyone together, celebrate a momentous occasion, encourage revelrous abandon

features.name: Loose Lips and Fast Friends
features.description: PCs have advantage on Presence rolls to socialize with the crowd. Critical Success: Learn valuable information and gain a useful contact. Success with Hope: Make a new friend who can help later. Success with Fear: Learn something useful but also something concerning. Any Failure: Mark a Stress as the conversation goes poorly.
prompts: What is everyone celebrating?
Who's footing the bill?

features.name: Are You Not Entertained?
features.description: Spend a spotlight to have the PCs become the center of attention through entertainment. PCs who participate become "Honored Guests" and can claim boons from the host.
prompts: What does the host want to see or hear more than anything else?

features.name: There's Always That One...
features.description: Spend a Fear to have a PC become trapped in an unpleasant conversation. They must succeed on a Presence Roll to extricate themselves or mark a Stress.
prompts: What makes this dud so unpleasant?

features.name: Last Call
features.description: As the feast winds down, participating PCs clear Stress and gain Hope. Honored Guests clear HP and gain additional Hope. PCs who overindulged risk becoming Hungover.
prompts: What crazy stories do the PCs share?

environments.name: Heist
environments.description: The party must gain access to a hidden or well-protected location to acquire the information or items secured within.
environments.impulses: Make the party prepare, split them up, throw up obstacles, trap them inside, use up their resources

features.name: Prep Work
features.description: PCs can gather information, surveil, or acquire tools before the Heist. Success grants advantages, while Fear provides less useful advantages.
prompts: How does the PC gain this advantage?

features.name: Infiltration
features.description: Uses Progress and Consequence Countdowns for the Heist. When the Progress Countdown triggers, activate "Exfiltration." When the Consequence Countdown triggers, activate "Sound the Alarm."
prompts: What is the party going after, and where is it located?

features.name: Saw This Coming
features.description: A PC can spend Hope to reveal prepared information or items for the current situation.
prompts: What did the PC prepare in advance?

features.name: Exfiltration
features.description: After acquiring the object, PCs must escape. Make a group action roll to avoid Stress and damage on failure.
prompts: What makes getting out even more dangerous than getting in?

features.name: Sound the Alarm
features.description: When the Consequence Countdown triggers, the location goes on High Alert. Summon Tier 2 adversaries with increased Difficulty.
prompts: What makes these adversaries uniquely suited to guard this location?

environments.name: Crystal Wasteland
environments.description: A harsh and alien landscape that shines with towers of glittering crystal.
environments.impulses: Cut them to their core, fracture their psyches, show their true reflection

features.name: Harmonic Resonance
features.description: Crystals reverberate with magical energy. PCs can attune to them for Spellcast Roll advantage.
prompts: What does the resonance feel like?
What childhood song does it remind you of?

features.name: Gravitational Anomalies
features.description: Spend a Fear to create localized phenomena that warp distance and direction. PCs take physical damage or Stress from the disorientation.
prompts: How does it feel to have gravity shift around you?
What advantage could this provide?

features.name: Arcane Reflection
features.description: PCs can spend Fear to glimpse reflections in the crystal, potentially replacing an Experience or marking Stress.
prompts: Who do you see in the reflection?
How does it make you feel?

features.name: Razor-Sharp Terrain
features.description: When a PC fails a navigation roll, they cut themselves on crystal shards, gaining the "Crystallizing" condition with Countdown (1) and Evasion penalty.
prompts: What do the crystals look like up close?
How do they feel to the touch?

features.name: Psychic Shuffle
features.description: After a long rest, PCs can spend Fear to swap psyches by redistributing character sheets. PCs can regain their original psyche with a Knowledge Roll.
prompts: What does it feel like to be in someone else's skin?
What aspect would you keep?

environments.name: Convergence, The City of Portals
environments.description: A sprawling metropolis at the nexus of creation, where influential figures from across the realms gather.
environments.impulses: Confront them with alien customs, dazzle them with infinite variety, tempt them with the impossible
potentialAdversaries: Power Players (Monarch, Demon Lord Orthrax, Fire Giant Warlord, Arch-Necromancer, High Seraph, Vampire Lord, Oracle of Doom)

features.name: Impossibilities Abound
features.description: Convergence is a nexus of various beings. Mortal PCs have disadvantage on influence rolls unless they have leverage.
prompts: Which being rules this district?
What strange customs do they follow?
How do the PCs react to this?

features.name: Into the Multiverse
features.description: The city has portals to every plane of existence.
prompts: Where does this portal lead?
Who controls access to it?

features.name: Everything Everywhere All at Once
features.description: The city has solutions to any problem. PCs can make Instinct or Presence Rolls to find items in the marketplace. Critical Success: Find exactly what you need. Success with Hope: Find something useful. Success with Fear: Find something that helps but has complications. Any Failure: Mark a Stress and find nothing useful.
prompts: Who has the item you need?
What do they want in return?

features.name: Don't Make Waves
features.description: Countdown (6). The city's bureaucracy and ordinances. Starts on arrival, ticks down when PCs upset political equilibrium. On trigger, PCs become "Wanted" and Temporal Enforcers are summoned.
prompts: What did the party do to upset the balance?
How can they fix this problem?

features.name: An Offer You Can't Refuse
features.description: Rival factions can offer solutions in exchange for allegiance. Refusal leads to Stress and inability to return to that faction.
prompts: Which faction offers support?
Who do they want the party to act against?
